SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Interface SigSchemeInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
SigScheme
public interface SigSchemeInterface
This interface defines the essential functionalities of a signature scheme.

It is intended to be implemented by classes that provide concrete implementations of signature schemes. The methods defined are fundamental to any digital signature scheme and provide a standardised contract to sign and verify data.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    byte[]
    I2OSP(BigInteger m)
    Converts a BigInteger to an octet string of length emLen where emLen is the ceiling of ((modBits - 1)/8) and modBits is the bit length of the RSA modulus.
    BigInteger
    OS2IP(byte[] EM)
    Converts an octet string (byte array) to a non-negative integer.
    BigInteger
    RSASP1(BigInteger m)
    Calculates the RSA signature of a given message representative by raising it to the power of the private exponent as outlined by the RSA algorithm.
    BigInteger
    RSAVP1(BigInteger s)
    Facilitates the verification of RSA signature by raising it to the power of the public exponent as outlined by the RSA algorithm.
    byte[]
    sign(byte[] M)
    Signs the provided data.
    boolean
    verify(byte[] data, byte[] signature)
    Verifies a given signature.

  • Method Details

    • sign

      byte[] sign(byte[] M) throws DataFormatException
      Signs the provided data.
      Parameters:
      M - Data to be signed.
      Returns:
      The digital signature.
      Throws:
      DataFormatException - if the signature format is not valid.

    • verify

      boolean verify(byte[] data, byte[] signature) throws DataFormatException
      Verifies a given signature.
      Parameters:
      data - Original data that was signed.
      signature - The digital signature to be verified.
      Returns:
      true if the signature is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DataFormatException - if there's an error during verification.

    • OS2IP

      BigInteger OS2IP(byte[] EM)
      Converts an octet string (byte array) to a non-negative integer.
      Parameters:
      EM - The encoded message as a byte array.
      Returns:
      A BigInteger representing the non-negative integer obtained from the byte array.

    • I2OSP

      byte[] I2OSP(BigInteger m) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Converts a BigInteger to an octet string of length emLen where emLen is the ceiling of ((modBits - 1)/8) and modBits is the bit length of the RSA modulus.
      Parameters:
      m - The BigInteger to be converted into an octet string.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the BigInteger in its octet string form, of length emLen.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the BigInteger's byte array representation is not of the expected length or has an unexpected leading byte.

    • RSASP1

      BigInteger RSASP1(BigInteger m)
      Calculates the RSA signature of a given message representative by raising it to the power of the private exponent as outlined by the RSA algorithm.
      Parameters:
      m - The message representative, an integer representation of the message.
      Returns:
      The signature representative, an integer representation of the signature.

    • RSAVP1

      BigInteger RSAVP1(BigInteger s)
      Facilitates the verification of RSA signature by raising it to the power of the public exponent as outlined by the RSA algorithm.
      Parameters:
      s - The signature representative, an integer representation of the signature.
      Returns:
      The message representative, an integer representation of the message.
